author: Christian Wait
description: As of Sept. 23, TCGplayer has major discounts on Pokémon TCG sets like Destined Rivals, Prismatic Evolutions, and White Flare, undercutting Amazon’s prices by up to $12.
title: Deals For Today: TCGPlayer Is Destroying Amazons Pokémon TCG Pricing Right Now

description: It's finally a good time to upgrade.

author: Jim Vejvoda
description: After ABC lifted its nearly week-long suspension on Monday, Jimmy Kimmel Live! returns to airwaves Tuesday … sort of. Nexstar and Sinclair Broadcast Group, two of the largest owners of ABC affiliate TV stations in the United States, will still indefinitely preempt the show. There are reportedly a total of 66 ABC stations in the U.S. that will not carry Kimmel’s show for the time being.
title: Jimmy Kimmel Live! Returns, But Not on These 66 Nexstar- and Sinclair-Owned Local Stations

author: Eric Song
description: The best prices I've seen all year on prebuilt gaming PCs with RTX 5060 to 5090.
title: The Walmart GeForce Week Sale Has Black Friday Worthy Gaming PC Deals

description: Early access starts on October 6.
title: Walmart Announces Rival October Prime Day Sale Promising Deals on Pokémon Cards and LEGO Sets

author: Scott Collura
description: It looks like the Fox X-Men are finally getting their proper comic-book costumes in Avengers: Doomsday. But is it too little, too late?
title: It’s Too Late for Comic-Accurate Costumes to Save the X-Men | Avengers: Doomsday

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Predator: Badlands is not a secret Alien Vs. Predator film, its director has insisted. There’s no Xenomorph in it either.
title: Predator: Badlands Director Confirms 'There’s No Xenomorph in This Movie,' So the Aliens vs. Predator Rematch Is Going to Have to Wait

author: Chris Reed
description: LEGO has updated its list of sets that are retiring soon, moving a bunch of great sets to the chopping block.
title: LEGO to Retire More Sets Soon - Here’s What’s on the Chopping Block

author: Lloyd Coombes
description: Magic: The Gathering is getting the six Infinity Stones spread across multiple sets. Here's all we know so far, and what we expect to see.
title: This Rare Infinity Stone Card Has Already Sold for $10,000 Before Magic's Spider-Man Set is Even Out

author: Tom Phillips
description: The Pokémon Company's former chief legal officer has said he would not take action over an official Department of Homeland Security video that features footage of people being handcuffed and arrested set to the Pokémon theme tune — despite calls from fans for the corporation to sue.
title: Fans Want Pokémon to Sue After Department of Homeland Security Video Uses Ash Ketchum to Promote ICE — But The Company's Former Legal Boss Says He 'Wouldn't Touch This'

author: Eric Song
description: An excellent budget card for current generation 1080p gaming.
title: The PNY GeForce RTX 5060 Ti 16GB Graphics Card Drops Below Launch Price for the First Time Ever

description: Don't let the movie be your first visit to the Borderlands franchise.
title: How to Play the Borderlands Games (and Spin-Offs) in Timeline Order

title: Baby Steps Review

description: If you're a fan of classic sci-fi shows like The X-Files and The Twilight Zone and are looking for a book that can scratch that itch, Little Visitor & Other Abductions may be just what the doctor ordered.
title: Little Visitor & Other Abductions Is The Perfect Book for X-Files Fans

author: Eric Song
description: One involves trade-in, another port-in, but the third could save you the most money in the long run.

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Larian may be done with major updates to its blockbuster role-playing game Baldur’s Gate 3, but it’s still releasing hotfixes. The latest, Hotfix #34, is a juicy one. It adds a native Steam Deck build and should reduce framerate spikes in busy areas such as the Lower City in Act 3 across all platforms. Check out the patch notes.
title: Baldur’s Gate 3 Hotfix 34 Adds Native Steam Deck Build, Reduces Framerate Spikes in Busy Areas Such as the Lower City in Act 3 Across All Platforms

author: Ryan McCaffrey
description: Ubisoft and developer Massive Entertainment have announced From the Ashes, a new story expansion for Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, the 2023 first-person shooter set in James Cameron's Avatar universe. From the Ashes will be available on December 19 – the same day as Cameron's upcoming Avatar: Fire and Ash film.
title: Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora – From the Ashes DLC Announced; Release Timed With Fire and Ash Movie

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: After a period of closed beta, Riot’s League of Legends fighting game 2XKO has an early access release date of October 7, 2025.
title: League of Legends Fighting Game 2XKO Has an Early Access Release Date, Community Tournament Sponsorship

author: Jim Vejvoda
description: We have exclusive first look at the opening credits sequence for Netflix’s new animated series Splinter Cell: Deathwatch and can also reveal the titles for the season’s eight episodes:
title: Splinter Cell: Deathwatch: Exclusive Opening Credits Sequence and Episode Titles Revealed

author: Hannah Hoolihan
description: The Fantastic Four: First Steps is coming to 4K and Blu-ray. Preorders are up for the 4K steelbook ($44.99), an Amazon Exclusive 4K steelbook ($74.99), and a Walmart Exclusive Blu-ray ($29.96) alongside standard 4Ks and Blu-rays. It's set to be released on October 14.
title: The Fantastic Four: First Steps 4K Steelbook Is Officially Up for Preorder

author: George Nash
title: Q9 Crowned Winners At The 2025 Delta Force Invitational

author: Tom Phillips
description: Sony has announced a PlayStation State of Play livestream will take place tomorrow, September 24.
title: PlayStation State of Play Announced for Tomorrow, September 24

author: Jim Vejvoda
description: One Piece, Netflix’s live-action series adaptation of the beloved manga, returns for Season 2 in 2026. IGN can exclusively reveal new artwork and photos of one of Season 2's most notorious new locations: Loguetown.
title: One Piece, Season 2: Exclusive New Images of Loguetown

author: Tom Phillips
description: Sony has announced Franchise Rewards, a new program that grants players the ability to buy physical PlayStation merchandise — if you unlock specific in-game trophies by a certain date.
title: 'We Lost PlayStation Stars for This?' Sony Announces Franchise Rewards, a Time-Limited Physical Merch Program With Items Locked Behind Trophies

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Borderlands 4 is rife with overpowered builds that use what developer Gearbox has described as “unintended interactions” to cause massive damage, even to the game’s toughest bosses on the hardest difficulties. The most infamous of these is the knife, which Gearbox has said it’s aware of but won’t nerf just yet. Now, there’s another new best boss melting build to add to the list.
title: Borderlands 4 YouTuber Tries to Nerf Proof Their Character, Instead Stumbles Upon What Is Almost Certainly an 'Unintended Interaction' That Does So Much Damage It Causes Bosses 'Total Existence Failure'

author: Tom Phillips
description: Harry Potter star Emma Watson has reflected on her current break from acting, and said that while she misses "the art" of film making, she does not miss promoting movies — a process of "selling things" she found "quite soul-destroying."
title: Harry Potter Star Emma Watson Stopped Making Films After Finding 'Selling Things' to be 'Quite Soul-Destroying'

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Speaking in a new interview, DC Studios co-CEO James Gunn has revealed what it’s like dealing with the fan requests around Batman amid the wait for The Brave and the Bold, and whether we'll ever get a 'Blue Gray Batman.'
title: 'There's a Religious Aspect to So Much of This Stuff That's Very Uncomfortable' — DCU Boss James Gunn on Whether We'll Ever Ever Get a 'Blue Gray Batman'

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Team Cherry’s post-launch support of massive indie hit Hollow Knight: Silksong continues, with Patch 2 now live. The developer has also offered initial details on Patch 3.
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Patch 2 Live Now, Team Cherry Offer Early Patch 3 Details

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Borderlands 4 developer Gearbox has indicated that in the short-term, it plans to buff underperforming gear and skills rather than nerf overpowered builds. Indeed, those instakill builds you've seen online are safe, for now. But, Gearbox insisted, they will get nerfed eventually.
title: Borderlands 4 Dev Gearbox Says It's Prioritizing the First Round of Buffs Over Patching Out Instakill Knife Builds, but It Will Eventually Address 'Unintended Interactions'

author: Tom Phillips
title: Hideo Kojima Announces AR Project With Pokémon Go Creator Niantic

author: Tom Phillips
description: Metal Gear Solid creator Hideo Kojima is collaborating with Niantic Spatial on a new AR project, announced this morning as part of Kojima Productions' Beyond the Strand livestream.
title: Hideo Kojima Announces AR Project With Pokémon Go Creator Niantic Spatial

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Hideo Kojima has discussed his upcoming PlayStation exclusive Physint during a Kojima Productions 10th Anniversary event in Japan.
title: Hideo Kojima Reveals Debut Poster for PlayStation Exclusive Physint, First Cast Announcement

author: Rebekah Valentine
description: During today's Beyond the Strand presentation, Hideo Kojima and Kojima Productions gave us an official first look at a new animated film set in the world of Death Stranding. It's called Death Stranding: Mosquito and, per Kojima and animation director Hiroshi Miyamoto's own words, it follows the story of a guy who sucks.
title: Hideo Kojima Shows Off First Look at Death Stranding Animated Film: Mosquito

author: Michael Cripe
description: Hideo Kojima and director Michael Sarnoski have confirmed that A24’s Death Stranding movie will tell a new story instead of retelling the events of the games.
title: Death Stranding Movie Will 'Tell a Story You Haven't Seen in That World,' Director Confirms

author: Tom Phillips
description: Hideo Kojima has revealed the first trailer for OD, his upcoming Xbox Game Studios project, during this morning's Kojima Productions: Beyond the Strand event.
title: Hideo Kojima Reveals First Trailer for Xbox Game Studios Title OD

author: Wesley Yin-Poole
description: Released back in July for the Switch 2, Donkey Kong Bananza lets you go bananas as Nintendo’s giant ape character Donkey Kong. Players can explore and find goodies by freely punching, smashing and digging their way through bizarre and colorful open-world levels. The game’s quirkiness and fruit-obsession extends to the varied sound effects — many of which were made by the staff themselves. Apparently, a lot of biting and eating was involved…
title: Donkey Kong Bananza Staff Had Tense Watermelon-Eating Session to Create the Nintendo Switch 2 Exclusive's Digging Sound, Producer Reveals

author: Adam Bankhurst
description: Hideo Kojima and Kojima Productions are celebrating the studio's 10th anniversary with a big Beyond the Strand livestream that promises to "offer a glimpse into future projects" in development at the studio behind the first two Death Stranding titles. We'll be covering this event live and updating this article with all the big news and reveals!
title: Kojima Productions Beyond the Strand Livestream: Everything Announced (Updating Live)
